speaker: ANNOUNCER (CHRIS CARTER)
line: Previously on The X Files:

speaker: ABSALOM
line: Their ships come in, drop the abductees. I go and get them so I can help them.

speaker: REYES
line: He goes by the name Absalom-- the nominal leader of a doomsday cult who believed aliens would take over the world at the Millennium.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: ABSALOM
line: When you came crashing in here I was trying to help him, too.

speaker: MINISTER
line: Ashes to ashes, dust to dust. We are here to deliver the body of Fox Mulder to its resting place. We pray to God to deliver his soul and to resolve the deep mysteries Fox Mulder sought so tirelessly to uncover. Let us pray now for his eternal peace.

speaker: MINISTER
line: "'I am the resurrection and the life,' saith the Lord; he that believeth in me, though he were dead yet shall he live; and whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die.'"

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was the last. His father and mother... his sister... all gone. I think the real tragedy... is that for all of his pain and searching... the truth that he worked so hard to find was never truly revealed to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't truly believe that I'm really standing here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I know. And I don't truly believe that... Mulder's the last.

speaker: KERSH
line: Smile, John. You look tense. I've asked you here to commend you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's this?

speaker: KERSH
line: A letter to the director citing your meritorious efforts in the recovery of Agent Fox Mulder. And a recommendation that you be considered for advancement.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sir, the Assistant Director here deserves more credit than I...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Deputy Director Kersh spoke to me at length before you came up. He thanked me and asked me to write you a letter, too.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Officially transferring you off the X-Files to a division more suited to your talents.

speaker: KERSH
line: Man of my word, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thank you for your support, sir. But all things being equal, I, uh... would like to give any transfer some thought.

speaker: KERSH
line: Fish while they're biting, John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, good morning, Agent Scully. How you feeling today?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fine. How are you feeling?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Me? Good. But then I don't got a little J. Edgar to lug around.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A.D. Skinner just called. He told me about your meeting with Kersh.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, whatever he told you I'm still going to be here to drive you crazy with questions and nagging doubt.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You'd be crazy to stay, Agent Doggett. This is a huge career opportunity for you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's not my career he's got in mind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: In six weeks, you go on maternity leave. Kersh transfers me out, guess what? He gets to lock that door over there for good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't owe me anything, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They put me down here to find Mulder. I found him. So what? We still got an open file on this case and I got big questions.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I heard the same speech come out of my mouth seven years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get out while you can, Agent Doggett... or you may never get out at all.

speaker: FIRST DECK HAND
line: All stop! All stop! In the net! Get the light! Down there! Further out!

speaker: FIRST DECK HAND
line: Get Coast Guard on the radio! Tell them to send a chopper out!

speaker: FIRST DECK HAND
line: Doesn't look like there's any big reason to hurry.

speaker: DR. FRANCIS OROVETZ
line: So, what's the deal here?

speaker: PATHOLOGY ASSISTANT
line: Body was found at sea. DA wants to know how it got there.

speaker: DR. FRANCIS OROVETZ
line: At 2:00 in the morning? I've once to see a DA down here in his jammies waiting for an answer.

speaker: DR. FRANCIS OROVETZ
line: I see a surgical cut or scar on the sternum, linear pattern scarring on each facial cheek. But for a certain enviable post-mortem intumescence this man is unremarkable. Short of this body sitting up and telling us what happened I'd say we've got a long night ahead.

speaker: PATHOLOGY ASSISTANT
line: Doctor... it moved.

speaker: DR. FRANCIS OROVETZ
line: Joke's on me, right?

speaker: PATHOLOGY ASSISTANT
line: Its mouth... his lips... they moved...

speaker: DR. FRANCIS OROVETZ
line: Yeah, well, maybe he's trying to tell...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's Skinner. I want you to meet me at the Bureau in about 20 minutes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: For what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I got a call from the police. Pathologist down in Wilmington, North Carolina. Fishermen pulled in a dead body 50 Miles offshore which they've now ID'd as Billy Miles.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Billy Miles?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Kid from Oregon. He was abducted same time Mulder was last May.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what's the big hurry now?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Now he's alive.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You told Agent Scully any of what you told me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: My strong recommendation, Sir: Don't. This thing pans out or not, you're going to reopen wounds that still need a lot of healing. Not to mention the fact that she's had a difficult pregnancy. You know that as well as anybody.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I appreciate your concern, Agent Doggett, but I wouldn't have told her anyway. Certainly not where we're going.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where are we going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'll say it again. We're opening up more than a grave here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I respect that, Agent Doggett, but under the circumstances I think not digging it up would be far more regrettable, don't you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. I think this is insanity.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, well, personally, I couldn't live with the doubt.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That what? That we buried a man alive? We found Mulder, you and me together. We saw the same body. Mulder wasn't just dead, he'd been dead for days. Had to have a closed casket. For crying out loud, the body was too far gone and that was three months ago.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The kid they pulled from the ocean, Billy Miles, from the extensive tissue necrosis, they think he could've been in the water for months. Heart beat, rate of metabolism-- it slowed to imperceptibility. I mean, the body had rigored. For all intents and purposes, he was dead. It's a fluke that the doctor even noticed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't believe it. I don't believe I'm even standing here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell is this?

speaker: CORONER GAFFIN
line: Assistant Director Skinner?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes.

speaker: CORONER GAFFIN
line: Arthur Gaffin, County Coroner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I asked you to keep this thing low key.

speaker: CORONER GAFFIN
line: Word spreads. Exhumation's big news any day of the week and you had the body moved to another county to a specific pathologist. Well, that takes people and paperwork.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I want these people out of here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, listen up, ladies and gentlemen. As much as you're here to see the horror show I'm not letting that casket open up until we get some privacy. It's a private matter.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thank you.

speaker: DR. FRANCIS OROVETZ
line: Agent Skinner, so no one's confused, this is a completely different scenario. I'm only here 'cause you asked for me. I don't expect to find anything in this box but a dead man. It's not going to be Curse of the Mummy, okay? No claw marks on the lid of the coffin.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'll say it again: insanity.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it true?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Slow down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I want to see him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I know you do...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I need to see him, damn it!

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're not going in there.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully, you can't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell me it's true. Tell me.

speaker: DR. LIM
line: It's so improbable... and I would have said impossible before this. The clinical fact he's alive when effectively this man, his tissue and I presume his neural and vascular systems are all in a state of decomposition.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What does that mean?

speaker: DR. LIM
line: That effectively he's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did they say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to see him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I know... but I wish you wouldn't.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You wanted to see me, sir?

speaker: KERSH
line: Yes, John. Please come in. I've been in this office just over six months and I haven't yet had to see a sunrise from it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I believe the sunrise isn't for another hour and six minutes, sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: It serves a man to have useful information, John. One never knows when he might find himself having to survive on his wits alone.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: I know you look forward to a future at the FBI, John. You take your job seriously. I hope you took my job offer seriously, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: As I said, I'm thinking about it.

speaker: KERSH
line: I got a call about this... Mulder thing. I want you to drop it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Drop it?

speaker: KERSH
line: You know the tune: if it looks bad, it's bad for the FBI. I'm throwing you a rope. Don't go and hang yourself with it now.

speaker: DIAGNOSIS
line: Acute Hypothermia Suddenly, the monitors begin beeping rapidly. BILLY MILES body convulses. SCULLY stares at the heart monitor where she sees that it seems to be registering two heartbeats. Then everything returns to normal. The door opens and a NURSE enters.)

speaker: NURSE
line: Who-who are you, and what are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing. I was just looking in on the patient and he started to go into grand mal seizure. I, uh, I-I think he's all right now. Um, it's okay. I'm, uh, sorry …... I'm a doctor. My name is Scully, and I'm with the FBI.

speaker: NURSE
line: You're here to treat him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No, I, uh... the man down the hall was my... is my partner and we knew Billy and I-I guess I was just hoping that there might be some indication that he was getting better... somehow. Anyway... um... you might want to tell the doctor about this. And, uh... and check those monitors carefully. I think I might have seen some kind of equipment malfunction.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm okay. I'm okay. Okay, thank you.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: All aboard.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know how you got in this building, Krycek, but whatever it is you want... you can go to hell.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you want from me?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Let's take a ride.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: The word on the street is he's back from the dead. He's a regular Houdini.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Tell me what you want.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What I want is to give you the chance to save Mulder's life.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You don't believe me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I don't.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I can push a little button and send thousands of nanobots lying dormant in your bloodstream sizzling to your brain stem and all I want to do with that power is save a man's life.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't think his life can be saved.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I have a vial that contains a vaccine. Mulder knows of it. His father developed it to fight the alien virus.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's no vaccine can help the man I found in that grave.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You found him, and you don't even know what you got.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It's a push of a button, Walter.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You can't do this to yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You asked me not to come in here, Agent Doggett. I hope you're not asking me to leave.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Concern's for your well-being, Agent Scully. That's all it's ever for. I felt this was a bad idea from the start. I told the Assistant Director so. Worrying about the effect it might have on you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean finding Mulder alive?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I know you came in here with the doctors. I'm sure you must have asked them what his chances are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett......However I felt about you when we first met, you changed my opinion with the quality of your character and of your work. Now, I am thankful to know you and I am thankful for your concern......But no matter what Mulder's chances are the choice not to open up that grave was wrong. And not because of me personally but as my partner on the X-Files. Now, the truth may hurt but it's all that matters.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What truth?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what caused this.

speaker: NURSE
line: You've got to come quickly! It's Billy Miles.

speaker: BILLY MILES
line: I don't really remember all that much of anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any idea what you're doing here, Billy? Do you have any conscious memory at all?

speaker: BILLY MILES
line: I remember water. And I remember being on the ship.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You were found by a fishing boat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not what you mean... is it, Billy? You mean... a spacecraft.

speaker: BILLY MILES
line: They took so many this time. But now I understand. They're here to save us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, that's great news. I'm going to let you two talk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett... Where are you going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Back to the real world. Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just won't believe it, will you? Not even for a minute. Not even with it staring you right in the face.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is that so important to you? What I believe or don't believe?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm really not up to this assignment anyway as you so gently put it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, you spoke with his doctors. He was lying on his deathbed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm with you, Agent Scully. It's a medical mystery, for sure. But don't ask me to take a load of horse crap for the gospel truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I underestimated you, Agent Doggett. I thought this was just simple... resistance to extreme possibilities... when, in fact, you're just downright bullheaded.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Do you believe it, Agent Scully? I mean that stuff he said about aliens coming to save the world.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Nobody called me about Billy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. I'm sorry.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What, this is incredible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's too incredible. Sir, there isn't a piece of medical data on him that isn't 100% normal.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why are you questioning that... when it could mean that the doctors are wrong about Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because it doesn't make sense. I mean, there should be blood, fluid, electrolyte imbalances. Loss of brain function, but as it is, it's like he shed his skin and literally became a new person. And I don't mean the same person.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are the chances this could be due to an alien influence? Could it be a virus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are you asking me this? Sir, if you know something... look, we-we're working against the clock here. This, this could happen to Mulder. And until we know what it is we have to do everything to control it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There may be a vaccine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It doesn't come without a price.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is about saving a man's life.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes. It is.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: Brother... you aren't someone I expected to be... paying me a visit.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How are they treating you?

speaker: ABSALOM
line: Treating me? Like a prophet.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's what I'm here about, your prophecies-- these preachings of yours.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: Oh... you misread me, is that it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I want to know about these men and woman you say you would find left for dead.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: You found someone yourself. Left for dead, but who's not dead?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: You're here to receive the word... and yet you can't bring yourself to say my name. Say it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Absalom.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: "I am the resurrection and the life. He who believeth in me... though he were dead, yet shall he live." Do you know the words?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They're from the bible.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: What is the bible? Preaching... Prophecy... Misread.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, I'm not here to debate theology. I'm here because somehow you healed these people and I want to know how you did it. I need your help.

speaker: ABSALOM
line: You ask for my help... But you refuse to believe in me.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It's hard to believe, isn't it... that Mulder could ever possibly get out of that bed?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need the vaccine, Alex.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah? Time is wasting.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do I have to do?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Oh, it's simple, really. Make sure Scully doesn't come to term.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're out of your mind.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: She can't have that baby.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. The answer is no.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: We all have a life in our hands. I have yours... you have Mulder's... and Scully has her unborn child. It's who's willing to sacrifice.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where are you going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I don't have time to waste debating our differences, Agent Doggett. I strongly believe that Agent Mulder is infected with a virus.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A virus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A virus that seems to keep the body just alive enough to take it through a transformation...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Into-- let me guess-- an alien.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, I don't have time to argue.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not arguing, and for what it's worth that's what this guy that first found Mulder told me. This man that we put in prison— Absalom?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He told you this was a virus?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. He said the abductees were being returned and left for dead. That if he hadn't found them and done his hocus-pocus they would've been resurrected as aliens. It was all part of some big alien takeover of the world.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How Billy Miles came back so perfectly. I stood there and watched his body go into seizure just moments before this happened. On the monitor, there were two heartbeats and I told the nurse that it was just a mechanical error.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You think this kid has sloughed his skin and come back as an alien?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And it'll happen to Mulder if we don't stop it soon.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where are you going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need a surgical bay, a team of doctors. I have to keep Mulder's body stabilized in order to administer the vaccine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What vaccine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The one I asked AD Skinner to get me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Assistant Director?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Open up. It's John Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You don't understand. went through the roof!!])

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're killing him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I had no choice. He wanted me to kill Scully's baby.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Alex Krycek-- for the vaccine. It's the only way he'd give it to me … but I couldn't trust him. I couldn't do that to her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Stop the car!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Stop the car!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You looking for this? It's the vaccine for Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett. Agent Mulder's in the O.R. Did you get the vaccine?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Listen to me. You weren't wrong. He wasn't to be trusted.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's going to make it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. I... I really don't know how we could've known.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That by keeping him on life support we were incubating the virus. We were hastening it along.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How'd you figure it out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: When Skinner pulled Mulder off of the machines, his temperature dropped rapidly without affecting his vital signs.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You mean Skinner saved him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What about the vaccine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If we can stabilize him and his temperature we can give him courses of antivirals. I think it could work.

speaker: KERSH
line: John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sir. Morning rush hour. I got here as quickly as I could.

speaker: KERSH
line: Missed the sunrise.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I was with Agent Scully.

speaker: KERSH
line: I know. It's going to be awful crowded down in that X-Files office.

speaker: KERSH
line: Maybe you didn't hear me. I said you're on the wrong floor.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god. Don't do that to me. noRomos.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know...? Do you have any idea what you've been through?

speaker: MULDER
line: Only what I see in your face.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anybody miss me?
